titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Edward H. Forney papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kendra Tsai

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-02-10T08:48-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

change.item: Container list added by Kendra Tsai.

did.abstract: Handwritten notes, correspondence, course writings, orders, reports, news releases, and news clippings relating primarily to the Korean and Vietnam Wars.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Edward H. Forney papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1965.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the library catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Edward H. Forney was a colonel, deputy chief of staff, and brigadier general in the United States Marine Corps, a senior advisor to the Republic of Korea (ROK) Marine Corps, and a scholar.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The Edward H. Forney papers contain handwritten notes (some in small notebooks), correspondence (including family letters), course writings, orders, reports, news releases, and news clippings relating primarily to the Korean and Vietnam Wars. Forney took numerous history courses about World War I, World War II, military operations in Europe and in the Pacific, psychological warfare, post-war problems, Soviet foreign policy (1918-1939), U.S. foreign policy, French military contributions in the American Revolution War, and the North Atlantic Treaty Organization. As brigadier general for the U.S. Marine Corps, Forney kept up-to-date about foreign relations among China, Southeast Asia, the Soviet Union, the United States, Korea, Vietnam, and France, as revealed in his extensive news file.

did.unittitle: "Brig. Gen. Edward H. Forney, United States Marine Corps," photograph,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Coursework and review sheets from various history courses taken by Forney.

did.unittitle: "History of the Flags of the NATO Countries," manuscript,

"The National Identity Card Program, the Federation of Malaya: A Research Report," by E. H. Adkins, Jr., Michigan State University Viet Nam Advisory Group in Collaboration with Public Safety Division, United States Operations Mission to Viet Nam,
"Map Used by Brig. Gen. Edward Forney, United States Marine Corps, During the Korean War,"
Amphibious Training Command, Pacific Fleet documents,
Photocopies of correspondence, organization description, annual report, and information for mail pertaining to the Holy Mother's Social Charity Work Catholic Organization,
"The March of the XX Corps from St. Jacques to Verdun, France: 600 Miles in 30 Days, One of the Fastest Sustained Marches in History," map,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plastic arrows colored red and blue, assumed to be used on maps, stored in envelopes. Envelopes have writings about NKPA (North Korean People's Army) and EUSAK (Eighth United States Army in Korea).
